item.title: Lost & Found: The Forgotten History of Pair A Dice Hotel & Casino in Vintage Las Vegas
item.description:
A Dicey Beginning: The Pair-A-Dice Arrives (1956)

The Las Vegas Strip wasn’t always the glittering behemoth it is today. In the 1950s, development was spreading north along Las Vegas Boulevard, and a surprising number of smaller, independent casinos popped up. Among these was the Pair-A-Dice Hotel and Casino, which opened its doors in 1956 at 2067 North Las Vegas Boulevard. While not boasting the grandeur of the Flamingo or the Sands, the Pair-A-Dice represented a vital part of the burgeoning North Strip landscape. Information about its early ownership and specific features remains scarce – a testament to how quickly it faded from the collective Vegas memory – but it likely offered the typical fare of the era: slots, a small poker room, and a modest lounge. Its location, further north than the established “center” of the Strip, meant it catered to a slightly different clientele, perhaps those looking for a more relaxed, less pretentious gambling experience.
